page.title: 18Rural - Farming
page.content: The farmland inthis area is all within 3km of the coast and is therefore totally within the very fertile coastal plain of Fife. Fife has been one of the most prosperous farming areas of Scotland for many centuries.James V described Fife as 'A reuch Scots blanket wi' a fringe o' gowd.'(A beggers mantle with a fringe of gold.) In the past few years there has been a considerable amount of Oil Seed Rape grown. In May and June, when the Rape is in bloom the countryside is transformed by the vast areas of bright yellow flowers. Government incentives mean there is a similar trend throughout the country. In addition to the Rape the main crops grown in this area are potatoes, grain crops and sown grass for grazing animals (mostly dairy cattle) on.
